metadata.Title: CVE-2019-18676 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in Squid 3.x and 4.x through 4.8. Due to incorrectinput validation, there is a heap-based buffer overflow that can result inDenial of Service to all clients using the proxy. Severity is high due tothis vulnerability occurring before normal security checks; any remoteclient that can reach the proxy port can trivially perform the attack via acrafted URI scheme.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-18676` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

squid - 3.5.27-1ubuntu1.7
squid-cgi - 3.5.27-1ubuntu1.7
squid-common - 3.5.27-1ubuntu1.7
squid-purge - 3.5.27-1ubuntu1.7
squid3 - 3.5.27-1ubuntu1.7
squidclient - 3.5.27-1ubuntu1.7
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: squid3 package in esm-infra/bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.5.27-1ubuntu1.7').
